intro: Hemisiphonia antillana, commonly known as the Caribbean sea hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky coastal areas, thriving in saline and well-drained soils. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. The plant is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
